result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court sentenced defendant to a Total term of 4 years imprisonment in WSP; 2 years initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision consecutive to any other time being served. Five days time served credit to apply.  Court grants ELIGIBLE for CIP and WISAP programs AFTER SERVING THE FIRST YEAR OF THIS SENTENCE.  The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation.
Concurrent with: consecutive to any sentence serving

miscConds.notes: Restitution ordered joint and several with co-actors James P (14CF281) and Josshua R (14CF282).  If revoked the court ordered all financial obligations and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school with part-time employment.
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms.
Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary complete follow-up care/treatment.

timeConds.notes: Release for DRC for treatment, job search, and employment.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Annamarie A. Wineke in court, defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing.  The Court unable to hear this matter on today due to lateness of the hour.  New date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in court with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Defense bail motion argued and denied by the court.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Annamarie A. Wineke in court, defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests projected plea date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.

Attorney Annamarie A. Wineke in court, defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Return on warrant.  Hearing proceeded.  Appearance of defendant waived for purpose of today's hearing.  Bail argument of the parties heard.  The Court orders $500.00 cash with tot Justice Point.   Parties engaged in negotiations.  The Court has no objection to global resolution with defendant's pending case before Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 7-17-14.  Defendant REMAINS REMANDED pending Return on Warrant Hearing. 
Filed, Original bench warrant.
No reply from surety or defendant.

CASE RECALLED.........

Defendant ORDERED TO REPORT TO JUSTICEPOINT forthwith.  Case remains set for Plea and Sentencing on 5-20-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actors James Antonio, Joshua Ritchie and victim Logino H.

Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in court with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for Jesica Balenger for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Bradley Blum.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Antonio Lavell Perkins in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
